item.title: Janet add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms—to choose one’s attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one’s own way." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: Janet add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "If you knew what was going to happen, if you knew everything that was going to happen next—if you knew in advance the consequences of your own actions—you'd be doomed. You'd be ruined as God. You'd be a stone. You'd never eat or drink or laugh or get out of bed in the morning. You'd never love anyone, ever again. You'd never dare to." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Janet add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "Everything changed the day she figured out there was exactly enough time for the important things in her life." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Janet add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Janet add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: Janet add a quote by Larry McMurtry
item.description: "If you want one thing too much it’s likely to be a disappointment. The healthy way is to learn to like the everyday things, like soft beds and buttermilk—and feisty gentlemen." -- Larry McMurtry

item.title: Janet add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Janet add a quote by James Marcus Bach
item.description: "GREAT SECRET Whenever I’m learning something difficult, I keep expectations low, and aspirations high." -- James Marcus Bach

item.title: Janet add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Janet add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Janet add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Janet add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "A book, too, can be a star, a living fire to lighten the darkness, leading out into the expanding universe." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Janet add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Janet add a quote by Amy Tan
item.description: "Because sometimes that is the only way to remember what is in your bones. You must peel off your skin, and that of your mother, and her mother. Until there is nothing. No scar, no skin, no flesh. -An-mei" -- Amy Tan

item.title: Janet add a quote by S. I. Hayakawa
item.description: "In a very real sense, people who have read good literature have lived more than people who cannot or will not read. It is not true that we have only one life to lead; if we can read, we can live as many more lives and as many kinds of lives as we wish. " -- S. I. Hayakawa

item.title: Janet add a quote by Po Bronson
item.description: "Books have been my classroom and my confidant. Books have widened my horizons. Books have comforted me in my hardest times. Books have changed my life." -- Po Bronson

item.title: Janet add a quote by Corita Kent
item.description: "Nothing is a mistake. There’s no win and no fail. There’s only make." -- Corita Kent

item.title: Janet add a quote by Leonie Swann
item.description: "No sheep may leave the flock," he said to anyone who would listen, "unless he comes back again." -- Leonie Swann

item.title: Janet add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Janet add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I like to see people reunited, I like to see people run to each other, I like the kissing and the crying, I like the impatience, the stories that the mouth can't tell fast enough, the ears that aren't big enough, the eyes that can't take in all of the change, I like the hugging, the bringing together, the end of missing someone." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Janet add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Janet add a quote by Jeanne DuPrau
item.description: "The trouble with anger is, it gets hold of you. And then you aren't the master of yourself anymore. Anger is." -- Jeanne DuPrau

item.title: Janet add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You don’t forget the face of the person who was your last hope." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Janet add a quote by Karen Maezen Miller
item.description: "You don't have to wait for happiness, because there's no time but now to be happy. You don't have to go somewhere else, because there's no place but here to find it. You don't have to do something else, because there's nothing more to it. You don't have to get something else, because everything you already have is enough. You just have to be happy. ..." -- Karen Maezen Miller

item.title: Janet add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description:
"Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.
[misquote of a letter about wine, see quotes/831031]" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Janet add a quote by wendell berry
item.description: "It may be that when we no longer know which way to go that we have come to our real journey. The mind that is not baffled is not employed. The impeded stream is the one that sings." -- wendell berry

item.title: Janet add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Janet add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Janet add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Cultivate the habit of being grateful for every good thing that comes to you, and to give thanks continuously. And because all things have contributed to your advancement, you should include all things in your gratitude." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Janet add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Don't try to comprehend with your mind. Your minds are very limited. Use your intuition." -- Madeleine L'Engle
